DICE Firmware Compiled on 8 Oct 2009
Main Page | Modules | Alphabetical List | Data Structures | Data Fields | Related Pages

Asynchronous Transaction Interface
[Link Abstraction Layer]

Detailed Description

This modules provides the interface for blocking asynchronous transactions.

This is the main interface used by higher level protocols.

Interfaces for Blocking 1394 i/o Read,Write,Lock functions

Using node addresses directly: lalReadNode() performs a read transaction on the specified node lalWriteNode() performs a write transaction on the specified node lalLockNode() performs a lock transaction on the specified node

Using handles mapped to the corresponding node address:

See also:
NodeInterfaceHandles
lalRead1394() performs a read transaction on the specified node lalWrite1394() performs a write transaction on the specified node lalLock1394() performs a lock transaction on the specified node

Interfaces for sending responses

lalReplyReadResponse() sends a response to a read request lalReplyWriteResponse() sends a response to a write request lalReplyLockResponse() sends a response to a lock request lalReplyErrorResponse() sends an error response

Interfaces for blocking i/o

lalSendWriteRequest() sends a blocking write request

Function Documentation

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalReadNode (  uint32  nodeAddr,
OFFSET_1394  destOffset,
uint16  numBytes,
QUADLET *  data
) 
 

Performs a blocking read transaction on the specified node.

Parameters:
nodeAddr The node address of the target node.
destOffset The address to read on the target node.
See also:
OFFSET_1394
Parameters:
numBytes The number of bytes to read.
data The memory location to store the read data.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalWriteNode (  uint32  nodeAddr,
OFFSET_1394  destOffset,
uint16  numBytes,
QUADLET *  data
) 
 

Performs a blocking write transaction on the specified node.

Parameters:
nodeAddr The node address of the target node.
destOffset The address to write to on the target node.
See also:
OFFSET_1394
Parameters:
numBytes The number of bytes to write.
data The memory location containing the data to write.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalLockNode (  uint32  nodeAddr,
OFFSET_1394  destOffset,
uint16  numBytes,
QUADLET *  data,
PB_LOCKTYPE  lockType
) 
 

Performs a blocking lock transaction on the specified node.

Parameters:
nodeAddr The node address of the target node.
destOffset The address to perform the lock on the target node.
numBytes The number of bytes to write.
data The memory location containing the data to write.
lockType The type of lock. The most common is PB_LOCKTYPE_COMPARE_SWAP.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalRead1394 (  LAL_NODE_HANDLE  handle,
OFFSET_1394  destOffset,
uint16  numBytes,
QUADLET *  data
) 
 

Performs a blocking read transaction on the specified node.

Parameters:
handle The handle for the target node.
destOffset The address to read on the target node.
numBytes The number of bytes to read.
data The memory location to store the read data.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalWrite1394 (  LAL_NODE_HANDLE  handle,
OFFSET_1394  destOffset,
uint16  numBytes,
QUADLET *  data
) 
 

Performs a blocking write transaction on the specified node.

Parameters:
handle The handle for the target node.
destOffset The address to write to on the target node.
numBytes The number of bytes to write.
data The memory location containing the data to write.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalLock1394 (  LAL_NODE_HANDLE  handle,
OFFSET_1394  destOffset,
uint16  numBytes,
QUADLET *  data,
PB_LOCKTYPE  lockType
) 
 

Performs a blocking lock transaction on the specified node.

Parameters:
handle The handle for the target node.
destOffset The address to perform the lock on the target node.
numBytes The number of bytes to write.
data The memory location containing the data to write.
lockType The type of lock.
See also:
PB_LOCKTYPE. The most common is PB_LOCKTYPE_COMPARE_SWAP.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalReplyReadResponse (  PB *  packetBlock,
RCODE_1394  responseCode,
uint16  numBytes,
uint32 *  data,
BOOL  bNonBlocking
) 
 

Sends a response to a read request.

Parameters:
packetBlock The packet block for which a response is being sent.
responseCode The IEEE 1394 response code.
numBytes The number of bytes in the response.
data The address of the data to be sent.
bNonBlocking TRUE to send non-blocking (function will return immediately and response will be queued).
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalReplyWriteResponse (  PB *  packetBlock,
RCODE_1394  responseCode,
BOOL  bNonBlocking
) 
 

Sends a response to a write request.

Parameters:
packetBlock The packet block for which a response is being sent.
responseCode The IEEE 1394 response code.
bNonBlocking TRUE to send non-blocking (function will return immediately and response will be queued).
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalReplyLockResponse (  PB *  packetBlock,
RCODE_1394  responseCode,
uint16  numBytes,
uint32 *  data,
BOOL  bNonBlocking
) 
 

Sends a response to a lock request.

Parameters:
packetBlock The packet block for which a response is being sent.
responseCode The IEEE 1394 response code.
numBytes The number of bytes in the response.
data The address of the data to be sent.
bNonBlocking TRUE to send non-blocking (function will return immediately and response will be queued).
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

_TC_INLINE HRESULT lalReplyErrorResponse (  PB *  packetBlock,
RCODE_1394  responseCode,
BOOL  bNonBlocking
) 
 

Sends an error response to a transaction request.

Parameters:
packetBlock The packet block for which a response is being sent.
responseCode The IEEE 1394 response code.
bNonBlocking TRUE to send non-blocking (function will return immediately and response will be queued).
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT lalSendWriteRequest (  PB *  packetBlock,
OFFSET_1394  destOffset
) 
 

Sends a write request.

Parameters:
packetBlock The packet block to send.
destOffset The address of the remote node to send the packet block to.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.
